main.name: Shrey Baid
main.bio: I am Shrey Baid. I studied Computer Science and Business at Cornell University (Class of 2022). I am passionate about Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, Finance and Entrepreneurship.

education.description: Computer Science (Dean's List - All terms); Minor: Business

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
work.description:
Worked in the Signals-Metadata Intelligence team to extend Facebookâ€™s Aggregate Event Measurement (AEM) platform to allow offline experiments and accommodate iOS 14 tracking opt-out users.
Implemented a dedicated AEM stack involving a data pipeline, asynchronous AEM simulation, experiment logger and revenue analysis, also allowing easy future experimentation. 

Ran offline AEM experiments to measure signal loss due to aggregation and measure revenue impact.

work.title: Undergraduate Researcher
work.description: Conducted independent research in Natural Language Processing under Prof. Claire Cardie to develop a novel long text summarization model. Fine-tuned BART on Novel, NarrativeQA and NYT datasets; explored multiple denoising functions to implement meaningful multi-document abstractive summaries. Aided in implementation of ROUGE metrics to evaluate and further fine-tune summarization models.

work.title: Teaching Assistant
work.description: Worked as a Teaching Assistant for CS 4820: Analysis of Algorithms with Prof. Dexter Kozen, previously as an Undergraduate Course Consultant for CS 1110: Computing with Python with Sr. Lecturer Walker White. Responsible for holding office hours, teaching a weekly section primarily in the analysis and development of complex algorithms including Dynamic Programming, NP problems etc. Also responsible for grading weekly assignments, exams and guiding a class with a 650-student enrollment size.

work.title: Co-op Software Engineering Intern
work.description: Improved stability of VOLTHA 2.x, a hardware abstraction tool based on SDN/NFV technologies for broadband access equipment, by configuring network stages using GO/fsm. Successfully aided in improving scalability of the platform from supporting 128 ONUs to more than 2000 ONUs by setting up automated testing framework to analyze and scale VOLTHA.

work.title: Data Management and Statistical Analysis Intern
work.description: Developed an Ethereum and IPFS based decentralized app for content moderation and distribution backed by Solidity smart contracts to ensure security, data affiliation and ownership.

projects.title: Auth.or
